intro: Salvia arguta, commonly known as woolly sage, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its gray-green, fuzzy leaves and spikes of violet to blue flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it well-suited for arid and semi-arid climates. Its aromatic foliage and showy blooms make it a popular choice for xeriscaping and ornamental gardens. Salvia arguta is also valued for its medicinal properties, traditionally used by Native American tribes for various health purposes.
